full_text:
HOAX: This website advertising over 5,000 jobs at Kenya Revenue Authority is a sham

The tax agency has disowned the site.

This website advertising over 5,000 jobs at the Kenya Revenue Authority (KRA) is a HOAX.

The site has also been shared on Facebook.

The homepage features a form requiring prospective applicants to provide details such as name, gender, and contacts. The post also requires one to validate the application by declaring citizenship, age, and level of education.

The final stage of the application entails sharing the link with at least five WhatsApp groups or 15 friends for the application to be successful.

However, the website with the jobs adverts has several red flags, prompting PesaCheck to verify its authenticity.

The website has a suspicious URL, "https://er.kra.or.programinfo.site/," which does not align with the URLs typically used by official Kenyan government agencies like KRA. Genuine Kenyan government website URLs usually end with ".go.ke". For instance, the authentic KRA website is "https://kra.go.ke/".

Additionally, the fake website asks users to share the links with WhatsApp groups, a notable red flag for online scams.

PesaCheck conducted a WhoIs search to verify the site's legitimacy and found that it was registered on 1 February 2023 in Arizona, United States. In contrast, the valid KRA website was registered on 12 February 2003 in Kenya.

The creation of the website in February 2023 raises another red flag since most online scams often use new sites to hide any previous dubious activities.

PesaCheck searched for the purported job vacancies on the official KRA website, but the search yielded no results.

At the same time, we came across a statement by the tax agency on its verified Facebook page and Twitter account disowning the website we are fact-checking.

PesaCheck has looked into a website advertising over 5,000 jobs at the Kenya Revenue Authority (KRA) and found it to be a HOAX.
